data.enText: to plant or spread seeds in or on the ground

data.chText: 周围的地里种上了小麦。
data.enText: The fields around had been sown with wheat.
to introduce or spread feelings or ideas, especially ones that cause trouble
to sow doubt in sb's mind

data.chText: 成为…的肇端；播下…的种子
data.enText: to start the process that leads to a particular situation or result
to go through a period of wild behaviour while young, especially having a lot of romantic or sexual relationships
you have to deal with the bad effects or results of sth that you originally started

data.id-g-sent: make a silk purse (out of a sow's ear)

ex.chText: 春天是最适合植树的季节。
ex.enText: Spring is the best season to plant trees.

ex.chText: 你在花园里种番茄了吗？
ex.enText: Have you planted tomatoes in the garden?

ex.chText: 他们在自己的小块土地上种粮食。
ex.enText: They grow food on their own plots of land.

ex.chText: 你知道美国一年种植多少吨番茄吗？
ex.enText: Do you know how many tons of tomatoes America grows a year?

synonyms.bx: 指种植植物或庄稼，强调播种或栽种完毕后的培育过程。

ex.enText: When do they usually sow the seeds?

ex.chText: 你们为什么在这些地里种燕麦？
ex.enText: Why do you sow these fields with oats?

data.chText: 成为…的肇端；播下…的种子
data.enText: to start the process that leads to a particular situation or result
to go through a period of wild behaviour while young, especially having a lot of romantic or sexual relationships
you have to deal with the bad effects or results of sth that you originally started
make a silk purse out of a sow's ear

data.chText: 用劣材制精品；化腐朽为神奇
data.enText: to succeed in making sth good out of material that does not seem very good at all

tr: place (seeds) in or on the ground for future growth
place seeds in or on (the ground)
example: sow the ground with sunflower seeds

value.def: If you sow seeds or sow an area of land with seeds, you plant the seeds in the ground.

example.ex: Sow the seed in a warm place in February/March...
example.tran: 2 月或 3 月里把种子播种在温暖的地方。

example.ex: Yesterday the field opposite was sown with maize.
example.tran: 昨天对面的田里播种了玉米。

value.def: If someone sows an undesirable feeling or situation, they cause it to begin and develop.

example.ex: He cleverly sowed doubts into the minds of his rivals...
example.tran: 他巧妙地令对手心生疑窦。

example.ex: Instead, the session has sowed confusion.
example.tran: 相反，这次会议却引发了混乱。

value.def: If one thing sows the seeds of another, it starts the process which leads eventually to the other thing.

example.ex: Rich industrialised countries have sown the seeds of global warming.
example.tran: 富庶的工业国家播下了全球变暖的种子。

value.tran: 播下了…的种子;开始了(某一进程)

value.def: A sow is an adult female pig.

trans: （尤指在性方面）放荡不羁，尽情玩乐
